Ken Lustbader and Jay Kidd were married at the Montreal Courthouse on Friday. Ly Ngor Tir, a court officiant, performed the ceremony.
Mr. Lustbader (above, left) is 45. He is a Manhattan-based consultant on historic preservation. He graduated from Vassar and has a master's in historic preservation from Columbia.

He is a son of Pearl Lustbader of Manhattan and the late Fred Lustbader. His mother retired as a medical stenographer in Brooklyn. His father was a founder of Fabco Shoes, a chain of 62 stores in New York and New Jersey.
Mr. Kidd, 49, is a psychotherapist in private practice in Manhattan. He graduated from Earlham College in Richmond, Ind., and received a master's of divinity from Union Theological Seminary.

He is a son of Sally Kidd of Westport, Conn., and James Kidd of Lexington, Va., and a stepson of Lilli Bradin. His mother retired as a teacher of psychology and American history at Brien McMahon High School in Norwalk, Conn. His father retired as a national accounts manager in San Francisco for Northern Telecom, the Canadian telecommunications equipment maker now known as Nortel.
